module.name: ExtCtrls
module.short: Contains extra controls commonly used in Lazarus forms

element.name: TBeforeShowPageEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler triggered before a page in displayed

descr.p: TBeforeShowPageEvent is an object procedure which specifies an event handler triggered before a page in displayed. TBeforeShowPageEvent can be used to perform actions needed to configure the page or its parent control before the new page is displayed.
TBeforeShowPageEvent is the type used to implement the OnBeforeShow event handler in TPage.

element.name: TBeforeShowPageEvent.ASender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TBeforeShowPageEvent.ANewPage
element.short: The page instance for the notification

element.name: TBeforeShowPageEvent.ANewIndex
element.short: The ordinal position for the page in the parent control

element.name: TImagePaintBackgroundEvent
element.short: Specifies an event handler signalled to draw the background for an image

descr.p: TImagePaintBackgroundEvent is an object procedure which specifies an event handler signalled to draw the backgound for a TImage class instance. TImagePaintBackgroundEvent is the type used to implement the OnPaintBackground event handler in TCustomImage.

element.name: TImagePaintBackgroundEvent.ASender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TImagePaintBackgroundEvent.ACanvas
element.short: Canvas for the image is drawn

element.name: TImagePaintBackgroundEvent.ARect
element.short: Rectangle with the dimensions for the image

element.name: TPage
element.short: TPage: One of the pages in a tabbed Notebook

descr.p: TPage is a TCustomControl descendant that implements a page displayed in a tabbed Notebook.

element.name: TPage.GetPageIndex
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the page in the TNotebook

descr.p: GetPageIndex is an Integer function used to get the ordinal position for the page in the TNotebook.

GetPageIndex checks the value in Parent to ensure that a TNotebook instance has been assigned as the parent control. The IndexOf method in TNotebook is used to get the position for the current page. When Parent is unassigned, or not derived from TNotebook, the value -1 is used as the return value.

element.name: TPage.GetPageIndex.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the page, or -1 when the Parent control is unassigned or not a TNotebook instance

element.name: TPage.SetParent
element.short: Sets the value for the Parent property

element.name: TPage.SetParent.AParent
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TPage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor, and sets the default values for properties in the class instance. The following properties are updated in the method:

dl.dd: Includes the values csAcceptsControls, csDesignFixedBounds, csNoDesignVisible, and csNoFocus in the set.
Set to alClient. The height and width for the page depend on the dimensions for the parent control.

element.name: TPage.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TPage.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that the page is also removed from the page list maintained in the Parent control (TNotebook). The action is not performed when the Parent control has csDestroying in its ComponentState, or when Parent has not been assigned.
Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TPage.PageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the page in its Notebook

descr.p: PageIndex is a read-only Integer property which contains the ordinal position for the page in its TNotebook container. The return value is -1 when the Parent control is unassigned, or not derived from TNotebook.

element.name: TPage. OnBeforeShow
element.short: Event handler signalled before a page is displayed

descr.p: OnBeforeShow is a TBeforeShowPageEvent property that contains the event handler signalled before a page is displayed. Applications must assign an object procedure to the event handler to respond to the event notification.

element.name: TUNBPages
element.short: Represents page names and class instances for a notebook

descr.p: TUNBPages is a TStrings descendant used to represent the names, TPage instances, and the owner class in TNotebook. TUNBPages extends the ancestor class by providing overridden methods needed to add, insert, delete and locate pages with a specified name or TPage class instance.
TUNBPages is used in the implementation of the TNotebook class.

element.name: TUNBPages.GetNotebookOwner
element.short: Gets the owner for the TNotebook instance for the pages

element.name: TUNBPages.GetNotebookOwner.Result
element.short: Owner of the TNotebook instance for the pages

element.name: TUNBPages.Get
element.short: Gets the name for the page stored at the specified position in the list of pages

descr.p: Get is an overridden String function used to get the name for the page stored at the specified position in the list of pages.

Index contains the ordinal position in the page list for the requested page. Index must be a valid position in the page list or an Exception is raised. The return value contains the name assigned to the TPage instance stored at the specified position.

element.errors: Calls RaiseGDBException to raise an exception when Index is not valid for the page list in the class instance. Raised with the exception message: 'TUNBPages.Get Index out of bounds'.

element.name: TUNBPages.Get.Result
element.short: Name for the page at the specified position

element.name: TUNBPages.Get.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the page requested in the method

element.name: TUNBPages.GetCount
element.short: Gets the number of pages defined in the page list

element.name: TUNBPages.GetCount.Result
element.short: Value for the Count property

element.name: TUNBPages.GetObject
element.short: Gets the TPage class instance stored at the specified ordinal position in the page list

element.name: TUNBPages.GetObject.Result
element.short: TPage class instance at the specified position

element.name: TUNBPages.GetObject.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the list of pages for the requested page object

element.name: TUNBPages.Put
element.short: Ensures that the index value is valid before accessing the TPage object

descr.p: Put is overridden in TUNBPages to set the name for the page object at the specified position. Put ensures that the value in Index is valid. Index must contain a value in the range 0 to the number of defined pages - 1. An exception is raised when Index contains an invalid value.
Put sets the name in the TPage object at the specified position to the value in S.

element.errors: Calls RaiseGDBException with the exception message 'TUNBPages.Put Index out of bounds' when Index contains an invalid value.

element.name: TUNBPages.Put.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the page object updated in the method

element.name: TUNBPages.Put.S
element.short: Name stored in the requested page object

element.name: TUNBPages.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

element.name: TUNBPages.Create.theNotebook
element.short: Notebook that is the owner of the class instance

element.name: TUNBPages.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

element.name: TUNBPages.Add
element.short: Creates a new page instance with the specified name

descr.p: Add is an overridden Integer function used to create a new TPage instance with the name specified in S. The page object is created using the return value from GetNotebookOwner as the owner of the class instance. Add calls the AddObject method to store the page object in the list of pages for the notebook.
The return value contains the ordinal position in the page list where the page object was stored.

element.name: TUNBPages.Add.Result
element.short: Ordinal position where the page object was stored

element.name: TUNBPages.Add.S
element.short: Name for the page added in the method

element.name: TUNBPages.AddObject
element.short: Adds the specified page object to the list of pages

element.name: TUNBPages.AddObject.Result
element.short: Ordinal position in the page list where the page object was stored

element.name: TUNBPages.AddObject.S
element.short: Identifier used as the name and/or caption for the page object

element.name: TUNBPages.AddObject.AObject
element.short: Page object stored in the method

element.name: TUNBPages.Clear
element.short: Deletes all page objects stored in the list of pages

element.name: TUNBPages.Delete
element.short: Deletes the page at the specified position in the list of pages

element.name: TUNBPages.Delete.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in the list of pages for page removed in the method

element.name: TUNBPages.IndexOfObject
element.short: Gets the ordinal position for the specified page object in the list of pages

element.name: TUNBPages.Insert
element.short: Inserts a page with the specified name at the given position in the list of pages

element.name: TUNBPages.Move
element.short: Moves the active page to a position in the page list

descr.p: Move is an overridden procedure in TUNBPages. It re-implements the method defined in the TStrings ancestor class. Move is used to relocate the active page in a NoteBook control to a new position in the page list.
Move uses the internal TNotebook member that is the owner of the class instance to retrieve the current page and its ordinal position.
CurIndex is set to the PageIndex for the active page in the Notebook component. NewIndex specifies the new ordinal position in the page list for the TPage instance.

The Move method in the internal page list (TObjectList) is called to move the TPage instance from using the required positions. The PageIndex for the TNotebook control is reset to re-activate the page moved in the operation.
descr.remark: Please note : Move does NOT call the inherited method.

element.name: TUNBPages.Move.CurIndex`
element.short: Current position for the active page

element.name: TUNBPages.Move.NewIndex`
element.short: New position in the page list for the page

element.name: TNotebook
element.short: TNotebook is a container for a series of pages placed together

descr.p: TNotebook is a control which can hold a series of pages placed together. Only one page is shown at a time and this control is completely custom drawn, which means that it is available and looks the same in any widgetset which supports TCustomControl. The pages are containers which can hold controls. This control never has tabs. If you are looking for a control with tabs and pages, please see TPageControl instead.

To use a Notebook, select its icon from the 'Additional' tab of the Component Palette and place it on the Form. Adjust its size, position, alignment and anchoring as required, by moving the object on the Form or by using the Object Inspector.

Pages are added to the NoteBook by selecting the control and right-clicking with the mouse to get a pop-up menu whose first item is 'Add Page'. Pages already in the NoteBook can be edited by selecting the appropriate ActivePage in the Object Inspector and modifying its properties or adding additional components to that Page.

element.name: TNotebook.GetActivePage
element.short: Gets the value for the ActivePage property

element.name: TNotebook.GetActivePage.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TNotebook.GetActivePageComponent
element.short: Gets the value for the ActivePageComponent property

element.name: TNotebook.GetActivePageComponent.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TNotebook.GetPage
element.short: Gets the value for the indexed Page property

element.name: TNotebook.GetPage.Result
element.short: Page object at the specified position in the list of pages

element.name: TNotebook.GetPage.AIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested page object in the list of pages

element.name: TNotebook.GetPageCount
element.short: Gets the value for the PageCount property

element.name: TNotebook.GetPageCount.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TNotebook.GetPageIndex
element.short: Gets the value for the PageIndex property

element.name: TNotebook.GetPageIndex.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TNotebook.SetPageIndex
element.short: Sets the value for the PageIndex property

element.name: TNotebook.SetPageIndex.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TNotebook.SetPages
element.short: Sets the value for the Pages property

element.name: TNotebook.SetPages.Items
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TNotebook.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance.

Create calls the inherited constructor using TheOwner as the owner of the class instance. Create allocates resources needed for members in the class instance, and sets the default values for the following properties:

dl.dd: Set to -1 to indicate that no page is selected or visible in the notebook.
Set to the default size for the class (GetControlClassDefaultSize).

element.name: TNotebook.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TNotebook.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for the class instance. Destroy ensures that resources allocated to the internal page list member are freed. Destroy calls the inherited destructor prior to exiting from the method.

element.name: TNotebook.ShowControl
element.short: Displays the specified control (page object)

descr.p: ShowControl is an overridden procedure used to display the control specified in AControl. ShowControl checks the internal list of pages for the value specified in AControl. The ordinal position for the page object, when found, is assigned to the PageIndex property and causes the page object to become visible.
ShowControl calls the inherited method prior to exit.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the method when AControl is the same as the control stored in the ActivePageComponent property.

element.name: TNotebook.ShowControl.AControl
element.short: Page object to display in the notebook control

element.name: TNotebook.IndexOf
element.short: Gets the ordinal position in the list of pages for the specified page object

element.name: TNotebook.IndexOf.Result
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested page object

element.name: TNotebook.IndexOf.APage
element.short: Page object to locate in the list of pages

element.name: TNotebook.ActivePage
element.short: Gets the name for the active page object in the notebook control

descr.p: ActivePage is a read-only String property which provides the name for the active page object in the notebook control. The value in PageIndex is used to access the page object instance in the Page property. Its Name property is used as the property value.
Use ActivePageComponent to get the TPage instance representing the active page object.
descr.remark: Should not be published because reading the property value can raise an exception.

element.name: TNotebook.ActivePageComponent
element.short: Gets the TPage instance representing the active page in the notebook control

descr.p: ActivePageComponent is a read-only TPage property which represents the active page in the notebook control.
descr.remark: Should not be published because reading the property value can raise an exception.

element.name: TNotebook.Page
element.short: Provides access to a page object in the notebook control by its ordinal position in the list of pages

descr.p: Page is an indexed read-only TPage property used to access a page object for the notebook control by its ordinal position in the list of pages.

element.name: TNotebook.Page.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the requested page object

element.name: TNotebook.PageCount
element.short: Indicates the number of page objects defined for the notebook control

descr.p: PageCount is a read-only Integer property that indicates the number of page objects defined for the notebook control. The value in PageCount is determined by the total number of entries stored in the list of Pages.
Use methods and properties in Pages to maintain the page names used in the notebook control.

element.name: TNotebook.PageIndex
element.short: Ordinal position for the active page in the notebook control

descr.p: PageIndex is an Integer property that indicates the ordinal position for the active page in the notebook control.
descr.remark: Please note: A value assigned to the property must must be in the range -1 to the number of defined Pages - 1. No actions are performed in the method when the new value for PageIndex is not in the required range.
descr.p: Setting the value in the property causes the active page object to be hidden; it is hidden at run-time and design-time using the Visible and ControlStyle properties. The OnBeforeShow event handler in the newly selected page object is signalled (when assigned). The page object is displayed by updating its Visible, ControlStyle, and Align properties.
The default value for the property is -1, and indicates that a page is not currently selected or available.

element.name: TNotebook.Pages
element.short: Contains the page names defined for the notebook control

descr.p: Pages is a TStrings property which contains the page names defined for the notebook control.

Setting a new value in Pages causes the new page names to be compared to the internal page objects in the notebook. New or altered pages are added or replaced in the notebook. An existing page object not present in the new page names is deleted; the Application singleton is notified that the page object is being released and allowed to process the message.
Please note: The value in Pages is not assigned at design-time.

element.name: TTimer
element.short: TTimer is an elapsed timer useful in many applications

descr.p: TTimer is a TCustomTimer descendant which implements an elapsed timer useful in many applications. It inherits most of its properties from TCustomTimer.

element.name: TIdleTimerAutoEvent
element.short: TIdleTimerAutoEvent is an enumerated type containing the events relevant to a timer

descr.p: TIdleTimerAutoEvent is an enumerated type containing the events relevant to a timer. TIdleTimerAutoEvent is the type used for the AutoStartEvent and AutoEndEvent properties in TCustomIdleTimer. Values in the enumeration are used when a timer executes its DoOnIdle, DoOnIdleEnd, and DoOnUserInput methods.

element.name: TIdleTimerAutoEvent.itaOnIdle
element.short: Timer responds to idle start events

element.name: TIdleTimerAutoEvent.itaOnIdleEnd
element.short: Time responds to idle end events

element.name: TIdleTimerAutoEvent.itaOnUserInput
element.short: Time responds to user input events

element.name: TIdleTimerAutoEvents
element.short: TIdleTimerAutoEvents is set type used to store TIdleTimerAutoEvent values

descr.remark: Not used in the current LCL version.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer
element.short: Implements the base class for TIdleTimer

descr.p: TCustomIdleTimer is a TCustomTimer descendant which implements the base class for TIdleTimer. TCustomIdleTimer extends the ancestor class to use events which toggle the timer state. In addition, support is provided for adding and removing its event handlers in the global TApplication instance.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.UpdateHandlers
element.short: Updates the event handlers used in the Application singleton

descr.p: UpdateHandlers is a procedure used to update the event handler assignments in the Application singleton based on the value in the AutoEnabled property. When AutoEnabled is True, the following methods are assigned as event handler:
descr.remark: Please note: No assignments are made to the Application singleton at design-time, or when the component is being loaded or destroyed.
descr.p: When AutoEnabled is False, the event handler routines are disconnected from the Application singleton.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed when handlers have not been previously assigned to Application, or Application has not been assigned (contains Nil).

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.SetAutoEnabled
element.short: Sets the value for the AutoEnabled property

descr.p: Calls UpdateHandlers to add or remove event handlers assigned in the Application singleton.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.SetAutoEnabled.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnIdle
element.short: Performs actions which execute the idle timer

descr.p: DoOnIdle is a procedure which performs the actions needed to execute the idle timer. The value in FireOnIdle is used to determine whether the timer can be executed for the idle state. When FireOnIdle is True, the DoOnTimer method is called to signal the OnTimer event handler (when assigned) and the value in the Done argument is set to False.

The AutoEnabled property is checked to determine if the value in the Enabled property can be updated to reflect the state needed for the AutoEndEvent and AutoStartEvent properties. If AutoEndEvent contains itaOnIdle, the value in Enabled is set to False. If AutoStartEvent contains itaOnIdle, the value in Enabled is set to True.
descr.remark: Please note: The Enabled property is not modified when AutoEnabled contains False.
descr.p: DoOnIdle is assigned as a handler for the Application singleton in the UpdateHandlers method.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnIdle.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnIdle.Done
element.short: True if the idle timer has already executed its OnTimer event handler

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnIdleEnd
element.short: DoOnIdleEnd performs actions when the idle state ends for the timer

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnIdleEnd.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnUserInput
element.short: DoOnUserInput performs the code for responding to user input

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.DoOnUserInput.Sender
element.short: Object for the event notification

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.Loaded
element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has finished loading during LCL component streaming

descr.p: Loaded is an overridden procedure used to perform actions needed when the component has finished loading in the LCL component streaming mechanism. Loaded calls the inherited method, and calls UpdateHandlers to connect/disconnect event handlers in the Application singleton.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for the class instance. Create calls the inherited constructor using TheOwner as the owner of the class instance. Create sets the default values for the following properties:

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy sets the value in AutoEnabled to False, and calls the inherited destructor.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.AutoEnabled
element.short: Controls whether the idle timer can be automatically enabled or disabled

descr.p: AutoEnabled is a Boolean property which controls whether the idle timer can be automatically Enabled (or disabled) in event handler routines. The default value for the property is False, and indicates that event handlers in the timer are not assigned to the Application singleton in the UpdateHandlers method.

The value in AutoEnabled is used in the DoOnIdle, DoOnIdleEnd, and DoOnUserInput methods. When AutoEnabled contains False, these routines do not perform actions which toggle the value in the Enabled property.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.AutoStartEvent
element.short: AutoStartEvent - the event that triggers autostart (either idle time-out or user input)

descr.p: AutoStartEvent defines, when Enabled is automatically set to true. This is one of the following events:

ul.li: on application stops being idle (e.g. user input or some timer fired)
user input, e.g. key press, mouse move

descr.p: The default value for the property is itaOnIdle.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.AutoEndEvent
element.short: AutoEndEvent - the event that stops the timer by setting Enabled to False

descr.p: AutoEndEvent defines, when Enabled is automatically set to false. This is one of the following events:

ul.li: on application stops being idle (e.g. user input or some timer fired)
user input, e.g. key press, mouse move

descr.p: The default value for the property is itaOnUserInput.

element.name: TCustomIdleTimer.FireOnIdle
element.short: FireOnIdle - Boolean property determining whether the timer should fire when idle

descr.p: The default value for the property is False.

element.name: TIdleTimer
element.short: TIdleTimer : A timer to measure idle time between processes

descr.p: TIdleTimer: A timer to measure idle time between processes.

element.name: TShapeType
element.short: TShapeType is an enumerated type with values representing standard geometric shapes

descr.p: TShapeType is an enumerated type with values that represent standard geometric shapes. TShapeType is the type used to implement the Shape property in TShape.

element.name: TShape
element.short: TShape draws an arbitrary geometric shape

descr.p: TShape is a TGraphicControl descendant used to draw an arbitrary geometric shape. It may be one of a series of standard shapes defined in the TShapeType enumeration.
It can be displayed using the Paint method, or the Brush and Pen tools.

element.name: TShape.SetBrush
element.short: Sets the value for the Brush property

element.name: TShape.SetBrush.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TShape.SetPen
element.short: Sets the value for the Pen property

element.name: TShape.SetPen.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TShape.SetShape
element.short: Sets the value for the Shape property

element.name: TShape.SetShape.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TShape.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size for instances of the control

descr.p: GetControlClassDefaultSize is an overridden TSize class function which provides the default size for instances of the control. The return value is updated in the method to use dimensions of 65 x 65 pixels.
GetControlClassDefaultSize is called from the Create method, and used to set the initial value in the Bounds for the control.

element.name: TShape.GetControlClassDefaultSize.Result
element.short: TSize instance with the dimensions for instances of the control class

element.name: TShape.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TShape: calls inherited Create, sets default styles and bounds, creates pen and brush

element.name: TShape.Destroy
element.short: Destroy - destructor for TShape: frees pen and brush, then calls inherited Destroy

element.name: TShape.Paint
element.short: Draws the shape for the control on its Canvas

descr.p: Paint is an overridden procedure used to draw the shape for the control on its Canvas. Paint uses the Pen, Brush, and Shape defined in the control. Drawing methods in Canvas are called to render the desired Shape to a rectangle using the Width and Height defined in the component.
Paint calls the inherited Paint method to signal an OnPaint event handler assigned in the class instance.

element.name: TShape.StyleChanged
element.short: StyleChanged - method for handling change of style by Sender

element.name: TShape.Brush
element.short: The Brush to be used for coloring this shape

element.name: TShape.Pen
element.short: The Pen to be used for drawing this shape

element.name: TShape.Shape
element.short: Indicates the geometric shape drawn in the control

descr.p: Shape is a TShapeType property that specifies the geometric shape drawn in the control. See for the values that can be assigned to the property.

element.name: TResizeStyle
element.short: Enumerated type with the drawing styles available when resizing using a splitter

descr.p: TResizeStyle is an enumerated type with the drawing styles and actions available when resizing using a splitter. TResizeStyle is the type used to implement the ResizeStyle property in TCustomSplitter.

element.name: TResizeStyle.rsLine
element.short: Draw a line, but don't update splitter position during movement

element.name: TResizeStyle.rsNone
element.short: Draw nothing and don't update splitter position during movement

element.name: TResizeStyle.rsPattern
element.short: draw a dot pattern, but don't update splitter position during movement

element.name: TResizeStyle.rsUpdate
element.short: Draw nothing, but update splitter position during movement

element.name: TCanResizeEvent
element.short: TCanResizeEvent - generic event handling method for resizing using splitter

descr.p: TCanResizeEvent specifies an event handler signalled when a control is resized. Use to the arguments to event handler to access the new size for the control and to set a flag that indicates if the new value is acceptable.
TCanResizeEvent is the type used to implement the OnCanResize event handler in TCustomSplitter and TCustomControlBar.

element.name: TCanResizeEvent.Sender
element.short: Object generating the event notification

element.name: TCanResizeEvent.NewSize
element.short: New size for the resize operation

element.name: TCanResizeEvent.Accept
element.short: Indicates if the new value is accepted

element.name: TCustomSplitter
element.short: TCustomSplitter is the base type for TSplitter

descr.p: TCustomSplitter is a TCustomControl descendant which implements a control used to resize, position and align a control to which it is anchored. TCustomSplitter displays a vertical or a horizontal bar anchored to the side of another control. Use the Align property to specify the orientation for the splitter control, and the adjacent control to which it is attached. When the splitter is moved with the mouse, the adjacent control with the same Align value will be resized.
This class defines many of the basic properties for the children classes, such as positioning, sizing and alignment.
Another usage scenario allows setting the Align property to alNone, and using AnchorSides and ResizeAnchor.
TCustomSplitter is the base type for TSplitter.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.GetResizeControl
element.short: Gets the value for the ResizeControl property

element.name: TCustomSplitter.GetResizeControl.Result
element.short: Value for the property

element.name: TCustomSplitter.SetBeveled
element.short: Sets the value for the Beveled property

element.name: TCustomSplitter.SetBeveled.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSplitter.SetMinSize
element.short: Sets the value for the MinSize property

element.name: TCustomSplitter.SetMinSize.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomSplitter.CMEnabledChanged
element.short: Handles the CM_ENABLEDCHANGED message

descr.p: Calls the inherited method, and performs the UpdateCursor method to apply the cursor shape needed for the value in ResizeAnchor.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.CMEnabledChanged.Message
element.short: Message with parameters handled in the method

element.name: TCustomSplitter.AdaptAnchors
element.short: Adjust anchor settings to reflect the value in the Align property

descr.p: AdaptAnchors is a TAnchors function used to adjust the anchor settings for the control to reflect the value in the Align property. a contains the initial anchors used in the method, and is assigned as the default return value.

The Align property is used to determine the correct TAnchorKind values used in the return value for the method. The following TAnchorKind values are included/excluded from the result based on the value in Align:
AdaptAnchors is called when a new value is assigned to the Align or Anchors properties.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.AdaptAnchors.Result
element.short: TAnchors settings derived in the method

element.name: TCustomSplitter.AdaptAnchors.a
element.short: Initial TAnchors values used in the method

element.name: TCustomSplitter.CheckNewSize
element.short: CheckNewSize ensures the new size is appropriate; returns True if successful

descr.p: CheckNewSize signals the OnCanResize event handler (when assigned) to examine and validate the value in NewSize. The values in NewSize and Result can be updated in the event handler as needed. True indicates that the value in NewSize is acceptable.
CheckNewSize is used in the implementation of the MoveSplitter method.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.CheckNewSize.Result
element.short: True when NewSize is an acceptable size for the splitter

element.name: TCustomSplitter.CheckNewSize.NewSize
element.short: New sized for the splitter

element.name: TCustomSplitter.CheckOffset
element.short: Signals the OnCanOffset event handler to determine the offset used when aligning the control, and the success or failure of the calculation
element.descr: Used in the implementation of the MoveSplitter method.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.FindAlignControl
element.short: FindAlignControl returns the main alignment control

element.name: TCustomSplitter.FindAlignOtherControl
element.short: FindAlignOtherControl returns another alignment control (the splitter may have to align two controls)

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MouseDown
element.short: Initiates the splitter movement operation

descr.p: Overridden in TCustomSplitter. Calls the inherited method, and ensures that the absolute mouse position is used when the left mouse button is depressed; The X and Y arguments are not valid during a resize operation.
Calls GetCursorPos to capture the mouse position, and calls StartSplitterMove to initiate the splitter movement operation.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MouseDown.Button
element.short: Button examined in the method

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MouseDown.Shift
element.short: Modifier for the mouse button

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MouseDown.X
element.short: Horizontal coordinate for the mouse event

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MouseDown.Y
element.short: Vertical coordinate for the mouse event

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MouseEnter
element.short: Starts mouse capture and tracking for the control

descr.p: Calls the inherited method. No additional actions are performed in the method at design-time, or when mouse capture has already been enabled for the control. Ensures that the internal flag used to track mouse entry into the control is set, and the control is refreshed by calling Invalidate.
Paint is an overridden procedure used to draw the splitter control. Paint calls the inherited Paint method, and adds additional logic to handle drawing the splitter control.
The OnPaint event handler is signalled (when assigned) to draw the splitter control.

When OnPaint is unassigned (contains Nil), an internal routine is used to paint the gripper bar using the TThemedRebar settings in ThemeServices. The control is drawn using the theme settings needed for the state in the Enabled, MouseInControl, and Beveled properties.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.AutoSnap
element.short: AutoSnap automatically moves the splitter to the zero position when split size becomes smaller than the value in MinSize

descr.p: AutoSnap is a Boolean property. AutoSnap automatically moves the splitter to the zero position when split size becomes smaller than the value in MinSize. Contains True when snapping to grid positions.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.Beveled
element.short: Indicates whether the edges of the splitter bar are beveled

descr.p: The default value for the property is crHSplit.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.MinSize
element.short: Minimum size for splitter; default is 30 pixels

element.short: Event handler for receiving permission to resize

element.name: TCustomSplitter.OnMoved
element.short: Event handler for occasion when splitter has moved

element.name: TCustomSplitter.ResizeAnchor
element.short: ResizeAnchor - the kind of anchor to be used for resizing
element.descr: akLeft for a vertical splitter, akTop for a horizontal splitter.

element.name: TCustomSplitter.ResizeStyle
element.short: Style for resizing - as a line, a pattern, full update, or none

element.name: TSplitter
element.short: TSplitter : A vertical or horizontal bar placed on a panel or form, to separate sub-panels functionally

descr.p: TSplitter is a vertical or horizontal bar that can be placed on a panel or form, to separate sub-panels functionally and allow re-sizing of the constituent sub-panels.

The splitter extends for the full height (if vertical) or full width (if horizontal) of the parent control (form or panel) and is anchored to the edges; its position along the length or height of the parent is determined by the programmer or user by moving the whole control with the mouse, and its size can be adjusted using the sizing bars and with the ResizeAnchor property.

element.name: TPaintBox
element.short: TPaintBox: a painted rectangular box with defined size and color

descr.p: TPaintBox is a painted rectangular box with defined size and color.

element.name: TPaintBox.Paint
element.short: Draws the content for the control

descr.p: Paint is an overridden procedure used to draw the control.
At design-time, a dashed black line is drawn around the area for the control and across its opposing corners. No other actions are performed in the method at design-time.
At run-time, the OnPaint event handler is used to render the content for the control using the Font and Color properties. The inherited Paint method is called to signal the event handler.

element.name: TPaintBox.GetControlClassDefaultSize
element.short: Gets the default size used for new instances of the class

descr.p: The default dimensions used in TPaintBox are 105 pixels wide x 105 pixels high.

element.name: TPaintBox.Create.AOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomImage
element.short: TCustomImage - the base type for TImage

descr.p: TCustomImageis the base type for TImage. This is a control descended from TGraphicControl, and is designed to be lightweight and fast.

TCustomImage provides a Canvas that is used to render the bitmap graphic in its Picture property. Additional properties are provided to control how the image is rendered, and includes: AntialiasingMode, Stretch, Transparent, and Proportional.

element.name: TCustomImage.GetCanvas
element.short: Gets the value for the Canvas property

element.name: TCustomImage.GetCanvas.Result

element.short: Sets the value for the KeepOriginYWhenClipped property

element.short: Sets the value for the Proportional property

element.short: Sets the value for the Stretch property

element.short: New value for the property

element.short: Sets the value for the StretchInEnabled property

element.name: TCustomImage.SetStretchInEnabled.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.short: Sets the value for the StretchOutEnabled property

element.name: TCustomImage.SetStretchOutEnabled.AValue
element.short: New value for the property

element.short: Sets the value for the Transparent property

element.name: TCustomImage.SetTransparent.Value
element.short: New value for the property

element.name: TCustomImage.PictureChanged
element.short: Performs actions needed when the Picture property has been changed

descr.p: PictureChanged is a procedure used to perform actions needed when the Picture property has been changed. PictureChanged adjusts the size for an assigned bitmap in Picture, and sets its bitmap transparency to the value in the Transparent property. PictureChanged calls Invalidate to cause the image to be repainted. The OnPictureChanged event handler is signalled (when assigned) prior to exiting from the method.
PictureChanged is assigned as the OnChange event handler for the Picture property in the constructor for the class instance.

element.name: TCustomImage.PictureChanged.Sender
element.short: Object instance for the change notification

element.name: TCustomImage.Paint
element.short: Draws the image to the control canvas

descr.p: Paint is an overridden procedure used to draw the image to the control Canvas. At design-time, a dashed black line is drawn around the image as a frame to mark the dimensions for its content.
descr.remark: Please note: No additional actions are performed in the method when a TGraphic instance has not been assigned to the Graphic property in Picture.
descr.p: Paint uses the Canvas from the ancestor class as the target for the drawing operation. The value in AntialiasingMode is assigned to the corresponding property in the Canvas. The rectangle returned from DestRect is used as the drawing area.

Paint signals the OnPaintBackground event handler (when assigned) using the canvas and drawing rectangle to render the background for the image. The StretchDraw method in the Canvas is used to render the image content.
Paint calls the inherited method to ensure that the OnPaint event handler is signalled (when assigned).

element.name: TCustomImage.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the constructor for TCustomImage, and calls the inherited Create method. It then sets the default values for the style, bounds and other local variables. Creates allocates resources for the Picture property.

element.name: TCustomImage.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomImage.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the destructor for TCustomImage. It free resources allocated to the Picture property, and then calls the inherited Destroy method.

element.name: TCustomImage.Canvas
element.short: Canvas used to draw the image

element.name: TCustomImage.DestRect
element.short: Gets the rectangle where the image is painted
element.descr: DestRect is a TRect function used to get the rectangle where the image is drawn.

element.name: TCustomImage.DestRect.Result
element.short: Rectangle where the image is drawn in the Paint method

element.name: TCustomImage.Invalidate
element.short: Causes the control to be repainted

descr.p: Invalidate is an overridden procedure which causes the control to be repainted. Invalidate is called when the content or dimensions for the image have been changed.

Invalidate extends the ancestor method to include logic that reduces the number of calls to the Paint method, and avoids flicker caused by the redundant calls. It uses an internal flag in the class to determine if the Paint method has already been called, but has not yet been completed. If the flag has not been set, the inherited Invalidate method is called to refresh the control using its visibility and control style settings.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the method when Paint is already active.

element.name: TCustomImage.AntialiasingMode
element.short: Indicates if anti-aliasing is used when rendering the image

descr.p: AntialiasingMode is a TAntialiasingMode property which indicates if anti-aliasing is used when rendering the image. The value in AntialiasingMode is assigned to the TCanvas instance used in the Paint method. Changing the value in the property causes the PictureChanged method to be called to invalidate and repaint the image to its canvas.
The default value for the property is amDontCare, and indicates that the default anti-aliasing mode for the platform, OS, or widget set is used.

element.name: TCustomImage.Center
element.short: Indicates if the image should be centered

descr.p: Center is a Boolean property which indicates if the image is drawn aligned to the center of the client area for the control. Center is used in the DestRect method to find the horizontal and vertical coordinates for the Picture aligned to the ClientWidth and ClientHeight for the control.
Changing the value for the property causes the PictureChanged method to be called to invalidate and repaint the image.
The default value for the property is False.
The default value for the property is False.
The default value for the property is False.

element.name: TCustomImage.Picture
element.short: Contains the image displayed in the control

descr.p: Picture is a TPicture property which contains the dimensions, format, and data for the image displayed in the control. Resources are allocated for Picture in the constructor; this includes use of the PictureChanged method as the OnChange event handler for the property.

Picture is used when the control needs to access its canvas for drawing operations. Drawing operations use the bitmap for the Picture when possible instead of the canvas for the form. It is also examined/updated when PictureChanged is called after values for properties like Proportional, Stretch, Centered, Transparent. and AntialiasingMode are changed.

element.name: TCustomImage.Stretch
element.short: Indicates if the image is resized to the client area for the control

descr.p: Stretch is a Boolean property which indicates if the image content is resized to the client area for the control. It is used in the DestRect method (along with Proportional) to calculate the rectangle needed to render the image content.
Changing the value in Stretch causes the PictureChanged method to be called.
The default value for the property is False.
The default value for the property is True.
The default value for the property is True.

element.name: TCustomImage.Transparent
element.short: Indicates if the image has a clear, non-opaque background

descr.p: Transparent is a Boolean property which indicates if the image uses a clear, non-opaque background. The value for the property is used in the PictureChanged method to set the transparency for the bitmap in Picture. Changing the value for the property causes PictureChanged to be called to update the image data assigned to Picture and to repaint the control.
The default value for the property is False.
Use AntialiasingMode to enable or disable use of the rendering technique. Use the OnPaintBackground event handler to render a custom background for the image.

element.name: TCustomImage.Proportional
element.short: True if image is proportional

descr.p: Proportional is a Boolean property which indicates if the proportions (the ratio of width to height) for an image are maintained when it is resized. When set to True, a change to the image size maintains the ratio of width to height for the original image. Proportional is used (along with Stretch) in the DestRect method to determine the rectangle needed to render the image in the control.
Changing the value for the property causes the PictureChanged method to be called.
The default value for the property is False.

element.name: TCustomImage.OnPictureChanged
element.short: Event handler signalled when Picture is changed

descr.p: OnPictureChanged is a TNotifyEvent property which contains the event handler signalled then the Picture property is changed. OnPictureChanged is signalled from the PictureChanged method, and allows actions to be performed after updates to image properties and the Invalidate method has been called.

element.name: TCustomImage.OnPaintBackground
element.short: Event handler signalled to draw the background for the image

descr.p: OnPaintBackground is a TImagePaintBackgroundEvent property which implements an event handler signalled to paint the background for an image. OnPaintBackground is signalled from the Paint method using the Canvas and DestRect for the image as arguments. The event occurs immediately prior to the image being drawn using its canvas handle.

element.name: TImage
element.short: TImage is a graphic image placed on the form; usually loaded from a picture file.

descr.p: TImage : a graphic image placed on the form; usually loaded from a picture file. The actual image is found in Picture or Canvas.
Inherits most of its properties from its ancestors, TCustomImage, TGraphicControl and TControl
The default value for the property is False.
The default value for the property is False.

element.name: TBevel.Create

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for TBevel. Create calls the inherited Create method, and sets the initial values used in the ControlStyle, Style, Shape, and Bounds properties.

dl.dd: Removes csSetCaption and csOpaque from existing values in ControlStyle.
Calls SetInitialBounds to store the values from GetControlClassDefaultSize in Bounds.

element.name: TBevel.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Assign copies the contents of Source to Self, if the classes of the destination and source classes are compatible.

The TPersistent implementation of Assign does nothing but call the AssignTo method for the source. This means that if the destination class does not know how to assign the contents of the source class, the source class instance is asked to assign itself to the destination class. This means that it is necessary to implement only one of the two methods so that two classes can be assigned to one another.

remark.p: In general, a statement of the form:
(where Destination and Source are classes) does not achieve the same as a statement of the form.
After the former statement, both Source and Destination will point to the same object. The latter statement will copy the contents of the Source class to the Destination class.

descr.p: Either reads a flag containing alignment instructions (FAlign) or writes alignment instructions (SetAlign).
May have no alignment, may have custom or client alignment, or can be aligned to top, bottom, left or right.

Determines how the control is anchored to its parent control. Either reads a flag containing the set of anchors to be used, or writes a set of anchors. If they have been written, this is indicated in IsAnchorsStored.
Determines the border spacing for this control.
Reads flag to find stored spacing values required for the border of the control, or writes the flag to set the spacing.
The properties are defined in the parent class TControlBorderSpacing.
Determine Constraints (max and min height and width) for this control; reads the size constraints or stores new ones.

element.short: Style indicates whether the bevel is displayed using a raised or a lowered style

element.name: TBevel.Visible
element.short: Makes the control visible or hidden

descr.p: The Visible property represents the ability to see a visual control. If Visible is True the control is shown, otherwise it is hidden. Calling Show sets Visible to True. Setting Visible to False is equivalent to calling Hide method.
descr.remark: The Visible property does not depend on control's parent visibility. Use the IsVisible method to consider this and get the real visibility for the control.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup
element.short: TCustomRadioGroup: is the base type for TRadioGroup

descr.p: A group of related but mutually exclusive radio buttons, selectable by the user.

This class defines Items, where the captions of the individual radio boxes are stored, Rows and Columns for arranging the radio boxes. The ColumnLayout property is used to determine whether the data are arranged down the columns first, or across the rows first.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.Clicked

descr.p: Clicked is a procedure used to perform actions needed when a radio button in the group is clicked. Clicked calls the CheckItemIndexChanged method to update the state for the radio buttons in the group, and to signal the OnClicked and OnSelection event handlers (when assigned).
Clicked is assigned to the OnClick event handler for each TRadioButton in the group. Use the Items property to specify the radio buttons required for the grouped control.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.ItemKeyDown

descr.p: ItemKeyDown handles the following unshifted virtual key codes:

dl.dd: Moves the selection to the prior radio button, with wrapping.
Moves the selection to the next radio button, with wrapping.
Moves the selection to the radio button in the prior row, with wrapping.
Moves the selection to the radio button in the next row, with wrapping.

descr.p: If Shift contains a key modifier, or Key has not been handled, the KeyDown method from the ancestor class is called to handle the values in Key and Shift.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.ItemKeyUp

descr.remark: ItemResize is an empty implementation in the current LCL version.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.CanModify
element.short: Indicates if modification of the RadioGroup is permitted

descr.p: CanModify is a Boolean function which indicates if modification of the RadioGroup is permitted. CanModify always returns True in TCustomRadioGroup.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.CanModify.Result
element.short: True when the control can be modified

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.FlipChildren
element.descr: FlipChildren is an empty implementation in TCustomRadioGroup.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.Rows
element.short: Indicates the number of rows in which Items (radio buttons) are held

descr.p: Rows is an Integer function which returns the number of rows needed to represents the radio buttons defined in the grouped control. The return value is the result of dividing the total number of Items by the number of Columns. The return value is zero (0) when no Items have been defined in the control.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.Rows.Result
element.short: Number of rows

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.AutoFill
element.short: Indicates if radio buttons are resized to fill the available space in the control

descr.p: AutoFill is a Boolean property which indicates whether child controls (radio buttons) are resized to fill the available space in the control. When AutoFill is set to True, child controls are resized by setting the EnlargeHorizontal and EnlargeVertical properties in ChildSizing to the value crsHomogenousChildResize. When AutoFill is set to False, the properties in ChildSizing are set to the value crsAnchorAligning.
descr.remark: Please note: DisableAlign is called on entry to the method, and EnableAlign is called prior to exiting from the method.
descr.p: AutoFill is set to True in the Create constructor.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.ItemIndex
element.short: The Index value in the list of Items (a stringlist with the names of the selections for radio buttons)

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.Items
element.short: Contains the captions for the radio button displayed in the control

descr.p: Items is a TStrings property which contains the captions for the radio buttons displayed in the grouped control. Changing the value in Items causes the UpdateItems and UpdateControlsPerLine methods to be called to add or remove radio buttons (when needed) and to adjust Rows for the number of Columns in the control.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.Columns
element.short: Number of columns used to display radio buttons in the control

descr.p: Columns is an Integer property that indicates the number of columns used to display the radio buttons in the control. Columns must contain a positive non-zero value; use of an invalid value causes an Exception to be raised.
Changing the value in Columns causes the UpdateControlsPerLine to be called.
The default value for the property is 1.

element.errors: Raises an exception when the property value is less than 1. Raised with the message 'TCustomRadioGroup: Columns must be >= 1'.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.ColumnLayout
element.short: ColumnLayout - HorizontalThenVertical or vice versa

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.OnClick
element.short: Event called when the selected item is changed

descr.p: OnClick is different from the usual event TControl.OnClick. Instead of occurring on a mouse click on the control, this event is occurs when the currently selected item changes. It will not occur if a click does not make the selection change, will not occur upon clicking a already selected item and will occur if one changes the selection via the keyboard. It also occurs when the item is changed programmatically. This is done for Delphi compatibility.
Note that Lazarus also offers another event for the same task with a better name: see OnSelectionChanged for more details.

element.name: TCustomRadioGroup.OnSelectionChanged
element.short: Event called when the selected item changes

descr.p: This event was introduced in Lazarus 0.9.31, and is called when the selected item is changed. It is triggered when this is done by the user via, for example the mouse or keyboard, and is also triggered when the selected item is changed programmatically.

element.name: TRadioGroup
element.short: TRadioGroup is a group of related but mutually exclusive radio buttons, requiring the user to select one of a set of alternatives

descr.p: TRadioGroup: A group of related but mutually exclusive radio buttons, requiring the user to select one of a set of alternatives. As one button becomes selected, the remaining buttons in the group become automatically deselected.

To Use this control, place it in the required position on the form, then in the Object Inspector select Items and click on the ellipsis (...) to open the string editor. Type in the captions to accompany each check box, then close the string editor and you will see a series of Radio Boxes with their captions displayed beside them. (Note - unlike TCheckGroup, there is no special RadioGroup editor).
Inherits properties from TCustomRadioGroup and TCustomGroupBox.
TRadioGroup behaves differently from a group of TRadioButton controls placed arbitrarily around a form.

In the case of TRadioButton, the mutual exclusivity is a feature that applies to any RadioButton anywhere in the Form, and the RadioButtons can be rearranged in any order or placed anywhere within the containing Form, while in TRadioGroup the exclusivity applies only to buttons within the Group, which are ordered strictly according to their ItemIndex within the Items stringlist.

TRadioButton is an entity in itself, with a number of additional properties, whereas the buttons within TRadioGroup are not separate entities, but rather are simply entries in a list of strings, each of which is associated with the on-screen image of a RadioButton.
The example shows the difference between the use of TRadioButton and TRadioGroup.

element.name: TRadioGroup.Items
element.short: Items - a string list containing the captions of the radio boxes

descr.p: Items - a string list containing the captions of the radio boxes.

Use the String List editor, opened by selecting Items and the ellipsis (...) in the Object Inspector, to insert the captions for the radio boxes, and determine their order and layout using the Rows, Columns and ColumnLayout properties.

This class defines Items, where the captions for individual check boxes are stored, Rows and Columns for arranging the check boxes, and ColumnLayout to determine whether the data are arranged down the columns first, or across the rows first.

Clicked checks the internal list of check boxes to find the ordinal position for the control in Sender, and calls DoClick to trigger the OnItemClick event handler.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the method if Sender is not found in the list of check boxes for the grouped control.

element.short: Updates the control when the Items property is changed

element.short: Performs actions needed when the component has finished loading from the LCL component streaming mechanism

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance

descr.p: Create is the overridden constructor for TCustomCheckGroup. It calls the inherited Create method. It also sets styles, creates lists, and initializes sizing and layout properties in the control.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Destroy
element.short: Destructor for the class instance

descr.p: Destroy is the overridden destructor for TCustomCheckGroup. It frees items and check boxes in the control, and calls the inherited Destroy method.
FlipChildren is an empty implementation in TCustomCheckGroup; no flipping is performed for the control.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Rows
element.short: Indicates the number of rows need to display Items (check boxes ) define in the control

descr.p: Rows is an Integer function which returns the number of rows needed to represents the check boxes defined in Items. The return value is the result of dividing the total number of Items by the number of Columns. The return value is zero (0) when no Items have been defined in the control.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Rows.Result
element.short: The number of rows used for the Items

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.AutoFill
element.short: Indicates if check boxes are resized to fill the available space in the control

descr.p: AutoFill is a Boolean property which indicates whether child controls (check boxes) are resized to fill the available space in the control. When AutoFill is set to True, child controls are resized by setting the EnlargeHorizontal and EnlargeVertical properties in ChildSizing to the value crsHomogenousChildResize. When AutoFill is set to False, the properties in ChildSizing are set to the value crsAnchorAligning.
descr.remark: Please note: DisableAlign is called on entry to the method, and EnableAlign is called prior to exiting from the method.
descr.p: AutoFill is set to True in the Create constructor.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Items
element.short: Items - a string list for the captions of the check boxes

descr.p: Items is a TStrings property which stores the captions for the check boxes on the grouped edit control. When the class instance is created, TCheckGroupStringList is used as the storage for the property values in the Items property.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Checked
element.short: Whether an individual entry in the list is Checked

descr.p: Checked is an indexed Boolean property used to read or write the state for a check box at the ordinal position specified in Index.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Checked.Index
element.short: Ordinal position in Items for the requested check box

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.CheckEnabled
element.short: CheckEnabled - whether a given (indexed) entry in the list is allowed to be checked

descr.p: CheckEnabled is an indexed Boolean property used to maintain the Enabled property for the check box at the position specified in Index. Index contains the ordinal position in the list of check boxes for the control, and must be in the range 0..Items.Count-1. An exception is raised when Index is not within the required range.
Use the Checked property to determine if a check box has its Checked property set to True.
Use Items to maintain the Captions for the check boxes displayed in the grouped edit control.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.CheckEnabled.Index
element.short: Ordinal position for the check box examined in the method

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.Columns
element.short: Columns is the number of columns in which the Items (check boxes) are arranged

descr.p: Columns is an Integer property which specifies the number of columns used to display the check boxes for the grouped edit control. Changing the value in the property causes the UpdateControlsPerLine method to be called. The new value for the property must be a positive non-zero value or an exception is raised.
The value in Columns is used as the number of controls displayed per line in the ChildSizing property.
The default value for the property is 1.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.ColumnLayout
element.short: ColumnLayout HorizontalThenVertical or vice versa

descr.p: ColumnLayout is a TColumnLayout property which specifies the layout strategy used when rendering the Items in the grouped edit control. The default value for the property is clHorizontalThenVertical, and causes check boxes to be drawn horizontally for the required number of Columns before advancing.
Assigning a new value for the property causes ChildSizing to be updated to use the corresponding value in its Layout property.

element.name: TCustomCheckGroup.OnItemClick
element.short: OnItemClick - event handler signalled when the mouse is clicked on one of the Items in the control

descr.p: OnItemClick is a TCheckGroupClicked property used as the event handler signalled when a check box is clicked for the grouped edit control. Applications must implement and assign an object procedure using the signature in TCheckGroupClicked to respond to the input event.

element.name: TCheckGroup
element.short: TCheckGroup is a group of Check Boxes physically and logically grouped together on a form

descr.p: TCheckGroup is a group of Check Boxes physically and logically grouped together on a form.

To use this control, place it in the required position on the form, then either right-click on the control to see the pop-up CheckGroup editor, or in the Object Inspector select Items and click on the ellipsis (...) to open the string editor. In either case, type in the captions to accompany each check box, then close the string or CheckGroup editor and you will see a series of boxes with their captions displayed beside them.
Inherits properties from TCustomCheckGroup and TCustomGroupBox.

element.name: TCheckGroup.Caption
element.short: String which appears at the top of the grouped edit control

descr.p: Caption is the string which appears as a caption at the top of the grouped edit control to describe the function of the Check Group as a whole.

element.name: TCheckGroup.Items
element.short: Items - a string list containing the captions of the check boxes

descr.p: Items is a string list containing the captions for the check boxes displayed in the grouped edit control.
Use the String List editor or the CheckGroup editor (opened by right-clicking on the control in the Form) to insert the captions for the check boxes, and determine their order and layout.

element.name: TBoundLabel
element.short: Implements a label bound to another control

descr.p: TBoundLabel is a TCustomLabel descendant which implements a label bound to another control. TBoundLabel is the type used to implement the EditLabel property in TCustomLabeledEdit and TLabeledEdit.
Use Caption to assign the text displayed in the label. Use Layout to specify the text alignment used for the Caption value.

The FocusControl property specifies the control given focus when a Dialog accelerator key or other input event in the class is handled. Use one of the AnchorSide* properties to specify the edge anchored to the FocusControl.
Other than a constructor, the class does not have any new methods or event handlers.

element.name: TBoundLabel.Create
element.short: Constructor for the class instance
element.descr: Create is the constructor for TBoundLabel. It calls the inherited Create method, and makes itself a SubComponent of the Owner. The Caption in the control is changd to the Name in the Owner.

element.name: TBoundLabel.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner for the class instance

element.name: TBoundLabel.FocusControl
element.short: FocusControl is the control to receive focus when the label is activated

descr.p: FocusControl also receives key messages in the DialogChar method.

element.name: TLabelPosition
element.short: TLabelPosition is an enumerated type with values that represent the position of a label relative to an associated control: i. e. above, below, left, or right

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit
element.short: Custom Labelled Edit

descr.p: TCustomLabeledEdit : The base type for LabeledEdit.
Note particularly the EditLabel property (see TBoundLabel), which contains the label attached to the Edit control.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetLabelPosition
element.short: Sets the value for the LabelPosition property

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetLabelPosition.Value

element.short: Sets the value for the LabelSpacing property

element.short: Sets the value for the Parent property

descr.p: SetParent is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to ensure that the EditLabel for the control is properly aligned after the value in Parent is changed. Calls DoPositionLabel to set the label visibility and position the label using the value in LabelPosition and LabelSpacing.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetParent.AParent
element.short: New parent for the control

descr.p: SetName is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to assign the new value for the property to the Caption in EditLabel at design-time. SetName calls the inherited method prior to exit.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.SetName.Value

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.DoPositionLabel
element.short: DoPositionLabel - perform the code for positioning the label

descr.p: DoPositionLabel is a procedure used to place the EditLabel relative to the companion control. No actions are performed in the method when EditLabel is unassigned (contains Nil).
DoPositionLabel ensures that DisableAlign is called in the Parent control (when assigned). EnableAlign is called for the Parent control prior to exiting from the method.

DoPositionLabel updates EditLabel to use the values assigned to the Parent and Visibility properties. The values in LabelPosition and LabelSpacing are used to determine the anchoring to the companion control applied to EditLabel.
Notification is overridden in TCustomLabeledEdit to ensure that a reference to the EditLabel property is released when Operation contains the value opRemove. Notification calls the inherited method.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Notification.AComponent
element.short: Component for the event notification

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Notification.Operation
element.short: Operation for the event notification

element.short: Handles the CM_BIDIMODECHANGED control message for the control

descr.p: Ensures that an assigned EditLabel uses the value stored in the BiDiMode property. Calls DoPositionLabel to update the control layout and position, and calls Invalidate to force the control to be redrawn.
Calls the inherited CMBiDiModeChanged method.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.CMBiDiModeChanged.Msg
element.short: Message handled in the method

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.CreateInternalLabel
element.short: CreateInternalLabel - method for internally creating label

descr.p: CreateInternalLabel is a method used to allocate resources for the EditLabel property in the class instance. TCustomLabeledEdit creates the TBoundLabel class instance used in EditLabel, and updates its ControlStyle property to prevent selection at design-time (csNoDesignSelectable). The current class instance is used as the FocusControl in EditLabel.
No actions are performed in the method if EditLabel has already been assigned in the class instance.
CreateInternalLabel is used in the implementation of the Create constructor.

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Create
element.short: Create - constructor for TCustomLabeledEdit: calls inherited Create then sets initial position and label spacing

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.Create.TheOwner
element.short: Owner of the class instance

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.EditLabel
element.short: EditLabel - the label attached to the edit box

element.name: TCustomLabeledEdit.LabelSpacing
element.short: LabelSpacing - the distance between the Label and the Edit box

element.name: TLabeledEdit
element.short: Labelled Edit is an Edit Box with a permanently attached Label

descr.p: TLabeledEditis an Edit Box with a permanently attached Label.
Saves time and effort over placing separate Label and Edit Box on Form. The properties are described in the parent component, TCustomLabeledEdit from which most of the properties are inherited.
TPanelBevel is an alias to the TBevelCut type. TPanelBevel is the type used to implement the BevelInner and BevelOuter properties in TCustomPanel.

element.name: TCustomPanel
element.short: The base class for a general container which can hold other objects. It has a customizable border and a central text.

descr.p: TCustomPanelis the base type for TPanel.

A Panel is a defined rectangular area on a form into which other components can be placed to group them functionally and geographically. TCustomPanel defines the positioning and beveling properties of any descendent classes, and provides methods for painting and writing text to the panel.

element.name: TCustomPanel.PaintBevel
element.short: Draws a bevel using the color and width defined for the panel

descr.p: PaintBevel is a procedure used to draw the bevel for the panel using the values in the BevelColor and BevelWidth properties. ARect is the rectangle with the coordinates where the bevel is drawn. ABevel contains the style used to draw the bevel.
descr.remark: Please note: No actions are performed in the method when ABevel contains the value bvNone.
descr.p: PaintBevel uses the Canvas for the control as the target for the drawing operation. The Frame3D method in the Canvas is used to draw the bevel with the required color, width, and style for the panel.
PaintBevel is used in the implementation of the Paint method to draw using both the BevelInner and BevelOuter styles.
